column1: Ageing Health & Wellbeing in Intellectual Disability - MSc/PgDip
column5: ﻿This interdisciplinary course will develop and strengthen the skills, competencies and knowledge of students, thus enabling them to promote and develop excellence in the delivery of care for people with an intellectual disability. Students will explore the physical health, policy and complex care needs of people with intellectual disabilities. The course will prepare them as leaders in quality and person-centred care for people with intellectual disabilities as they age.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
